passages.text: Weak 1H25 results on DP margin miss; maintain Neutral

Weak 1H25 results; gross margin likely to stay under pressure in 2H25F Longfor reported weak 1H25 results (29 Aug); interim revenue increased \(25\%\) y- y to CNY58.8bn, mainly driven by more development property (DP) revenue recognition (CNY45.5bn, up \(35\%\) y- y). However, core net profit dropped by \(c.70\%\) y- y to CNY1.4bn in 1H25, largely in line with its profit warning, as DP profitability further deteriorated (1H25 GPM: \(0.2\%\) , - 7.2pp y- y). On a positive note, Longfor's leverage continued to improve; interest- bearing debt reduced by CNY6.5bn h- h and average financing cost fell to a historical low of \(3.58\%\) . Looking ahead, we expect the gross margin of Longfor's property sales segment to remain under pressure due to the low margin profile of unbooked presales. For FY25F, we now forecast a slightly negative DP gross margin and anticipate more impairments, thus cutting our core earnings forecast to CNY3.1bn (- \(56\%\) y- y). We see no company- specific catalysts to drive Longfor's share price and thus remain Neutral.

Longfor continues to expand its non- DP businesses. The company operated 89 shopping malls in 1H25 with a high occupancy rate of \(97\%\) , delivering \(17\%\) y- y growth of total mall sales (SSSG: \(+3\%\) ); ten additional malls are scheduled to open in 2H25F, and we expect its rental income growth to accelerate in FY26F after renovations at its core malls are completed. Meanwhile, Longfor's emerging construction segment recorded contracted sales of CNY8.4bn and delivered 1.22mn sqm in 1H25, continuing to expand its full- cycle construction services. While these segments should support longer- term earnings sustainability, we believe the current scale remains insufficient to offset the weakness of its core DP business ( \(77\%\) revenue contribution in 1H25).

We cut our FY25F- 27F earnings estimates by \(15 - 40\%\) , and FY25F NAV estimate to HKD19.30 (from HKD21.10) to factor in the worse- than- expected DP's gross margin. Meanwhile, we lower our target NAV discount to \(45\%\) (from \(55\%\) ), to reflect the capital market's improving sentiment towards the company's China assets, in- line with our adjustments for other leading developers. We thus arrive at a target price of HKD10.70 (from HKD9.50; Fig2). Longfor currently trades at a 20.9x FY25F P/E. We prefer Beike (BEKE US, Buy) in the property value chain.
Source: Company data, Nomura estimates

Longfor is a privately- owned developer founded by Madam Wu Yajun. The company was founded in Chongqing in 1993 and has 30 years of property development and commercial property operation experience. Longfor's business mainly covers mainland China and Hong Kong SAR.
Our target price for Longfor of HKD10.70 is based on a 2025F NAV estimate of HKD19.30 per share and a target NAV discount of 45%. The benchmark index for the stock is the HSI.

Key upside risks to our Neutral rating and target price include: 1) faster- than- expected sales recovery; 2) stronger- than- expected policy stimulus. Key downside risks include: 1) slower- than- expected earnings growth; 2) weaker- than- expected shopping mall performance.

Longfor is a privately- owned developer with its headquarter in Beijing. Longfor's current chairman and CEO is Mr. Chen Xuping. The biggest shareholder of Longfor is the Wu Family with \(42.6\%\) shareholding (as of end- 2021). There are nine members on the board of Longfor, with four being independent non- executive directors. Female employees accounted for \(39\%\) of the total as of end- 2021. Longfor has: 1) actively explored innovative businesses such as elderly care and urbanization projects, and promoted the digitalization processes as well as formed a "balanced multi- dimensional businesses with digital base" product and service structure, 2) sought to achieve the scientific "carbon peak" throughout property projects' life cycle, and 3) adhered to the employer value proposition of "Longfor for Me Forever" to improve its ESG performance.

Valuation Methodology Our target price of US\\$23.60 is derived from a DCF model with WACC of \(10.7\%\) long term growth rate of \(5.5\%\) and cash flows discounted back to 2025F. The benchmark index of Ke Holdings is the NASDAQ Index. Risks that may impede the achievement of the target price Downside risks to our Buy rating and target price include 1) longterm market share constraints, 2) continued property sector weakness and 3) restrictive regulatory measures.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduced', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. Securities and/or companies that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'No rating' are not in regular research coverage. Investors should not expect continuing or additional information from Nomura relating to such securities and/or companies. Benchmarks are as follows: United States/Europe/Asia ex- Japan: please see valuation methodologies for explanations of relevant benchmarks for stocks, which can be accessed at: http://go.nomuranow.com/research/m/Disclosures; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia, unless otherwise stated in the valuation methodology; Japan: Russell/Nomura Large Cap.

A 'Bullish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to outperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Sectors that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'N/A' are not assigned ratings. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia. Japan/Asia ex- Japan: Sector ratings are not assigned.

A Target Price, if discussed, indicates the analyst's forecast for the share price with a 12- month time horizon, reflecting in part the analyst's estimates for the company's earnings. The achievement of any target price may be impeded by general market and macroeconomic trends, and by other risks related to the company or the market, and may not occur if the company's earnings differ from estimates.
